title: Amiri Decision No. (46) of 2022 on The Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Transport
title_en: Amiri Decision No. (46) of 2022 on The Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Transport
short_name: Amiri Decision No. (46) of 2022 on The Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Transport
description: Official legislation text retrieved from Al Meezan Legal Portal (English laws list source).

provisions.title: Article (1)
provisions.content:
Administrative units affiliated with the Minister:
Minister’s Office
Technical Office
Internal Audit Department
Planning, Quality, and Innovation Department
Legal Affairs Department
International Cooperation Department

provisions.title: Article (2)
provisions.content:
The Technical Office shall be responsible for the following:
Providing technical opinions on matters referred to it by the Minister.
Studying and evaluating reports, projects, and programs related to the Ministry's activities, as referred to it by the Minister.
Researching, studying, and following up on matters referred to it by the Minister, in coordination with relevant administrative units.
Preparing summaries of subjects, reports, and studies that need to be presented to the Minister and giving opinions thereon.

provisions.title: Article (3)
provisions.content:
The Internal Audit Department shall be responsible for the following:
Preparing a draft annual risk-based audit plan for the Ministry, submitting it to the Minister for approval, and preparing reports on audit results.
Monitoring compliance with laws, regulations, and decisions governing work.
Reviewing financial instructions, proposing necessary amendments, and monitoring their implementation.
Monitoring administrative activities and procedures for appointing employees, vacations, promotions, and other staff-related matters, ensuring compliance with governing laws and regulations.
Monitoring financial and accounting activities, disbursement vouchers, record- keeping procedures, and ensuring adherence to approved rules.
Assessing financial and administrative audit risks and proposing measures to mitigate them.
Following up on corrective actions required from relevant administrative units based on audit findings and preparing periodic reports.
Ensuring the safety of funds, assets, furniture, tools, buildings, and other properties owned or supervised by the Ministry.
Participating in regular and surprise inventory checks of stores and assets, and verifying the accuracy of recordkeeping and procedures.
Following up on the results of reports issued by regulatory bodies and providing appropriate recommendations.

provisions.title: Article (4)
provisions.content:
The Planning, Quality, and Innovation Department shall be responsible for the following:
Preparing the Ministry’s strategic plan, in coordination with relevant entities and administrative units, and taking the necessary steps for its approval.
Identifying existing challenges, determining and assessing potential institutional risks that may affect the Ministry's objectives, and submitting proposals accordingly, in coordination with the concerned units.
Managing and preparing alternative plans to ensure business continuity during emergencies and crises, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Submitting the implementation plans, projects, and programs of the various administrative units for the Minister’s approval.
Following up on the implementation of plans related to the Ministry’s activities, evaluating outcomes, and submitting periodic reports.
Studying problems and obstacles facing the implementation of the strategic and operational plans, and proposing appropriate solutions.
Evaluating the quality of services provided by the administrative units, in coordination with the competent entity.
Reviewing and evaluating performance quality at the level of administrative units and proposing measures to enhance their overall efficiency.
Ensuring the consistency of work systems and methods with the Ministry’s functions and objectives, proposing development plans for these systems and methods, and streamlining procedures, in coordination with relevant units and authorities.
Studying work-related issues and obstacles within the Ministry, identifying causes, and proposing the appropriate solutions.
Receiving initiatives, proposals, and creative ideas, and studying them in coordination with relevant units and competent entities.
Collecting, compiling, and analyzing statistical data related to the Ministry’s activities, and coordinating with concerned administrative units regarding required statistical reports.
Coordinating with relevant units and entities regarding international indicators related to the Ministry's activities and competencies.

provisions.title: Article (5)
provisions.content:
The Legal Affairs Department shall be responsible for the following:
Researching, studying, and following up on legal matters related to the
Ministry’s activities, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Preparing draft legislative instruments related to the Ministry and providing opinions on draft laws referred to it.
Providing legal opinions on matters referred to it.
Drafting contracts, agreements, and memorandums of understanding related to the Ministry’s areas of competence, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Investigating incidents and violations attributed to Ministry employees, preparing necessary reports with legal opinions and recommendations, submitting them to the competent authority, and following up on decisions issued.
Following up on disputes and legal cases in which the Ministry is a party, in coordination with competent authorities.

provisions.title: Article (6)
provisions.content:
The International Cooperation Department shall be responsible for the following:
Preparing working papers for conferences, seminars, and meetings—local, regional, and international—related to the Ministry’s activities, in coordination with relevant units and entities.
Organizing participation in conferences and meetings held by regional and international organizations relevant to the Ministry’s fields of work and in which the State holds membership.
Preparing reports and responses requested by regional and international organizations and authorities regarding the Ministry’s activities, in coordination with competent administrative units.
Studying and following up on the implementation of recommendations from regional and international organizations concerning the Ministry’s work, in coordination with concerned State entities.
Preparing reports on contributions of regional and international organizations and authorities to the development and support of various activities within the Ministry’s fields of work, in coordination with concerned entities.
Monitoring the State’s financial contributions to organizations in the Ministry’s fields of work, in which the State holds membership, in coordination with relevant entities.
Studying ways to enhance the State’s role in the Ministry’s fields of activity with Arab, regional, and international organizations.
Collecting and disseminating information and research issued by organizations related to the Ministry’s issues at local, regional, and international levels.
Translating documents, books, scientific research, and foreign correspondence related to the Ministry’s competencies.

provisions.title: Article (7)
provisions.content:
The Public Relations and Communications Department shall be responsible for the following:
Issuing newsletters and media programs to promote the Ministry’s role, activities, and competencies, in coordination with relevant units.
Monitoring and following up on what is published in newspapers, media outlets, and social media regarding the Ministry and its competencies, presenting them to officials, and preparing appropriate responses, in coordination with concerned units and authorities.
Coordinating with competent administrative units to prepare awareness and educational plans and programs and implementing them through various events and activities, in coordination with relevant entities.
Receiving requests and complaints from the reviewers, referring them to the appropriate units, and responding to their inquiries.
Handling travel, hospitality, and accommodation arrangements for Ministry guests and visiting/departing delegations, in coordination with concerned administrative units.
Organizing cultural, social, and sports activities for Ministry staff and supervising events held or attended by the Ministry.
Organizing conferences, seminars, and exhibitions held by the Ministry and preparing the necessary budget, in coordination with concerned units and entities.

provisions.title: Article (8)
provisions.content:
The Human Resources Department shall be responsible for the following:
Implementing laws, regulations, and systems related to personnel affairs.
Preparing studies related to human resource planning within the Ministry and identifying its needs in terms of jobs and staff, in coordination with the competent authority and various administrative units.
Preparing the job description, classification, and ranking project, and following up on its implementation and development.
Preparing the draft budget for Chapter I, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Implementing employee performance appraisal procedures.
Carrying out appointment, transfer, secondment, and delegation procedures.
Studying employee entitlement to leaves, in accordance with the law.
Preparing studies related to the Ministry’s organizational structure and submitting proposals for improving its administrative organization.
Identifying training needs for the Ministry’s employees, coordinating with the various administrative units, following up on implementation, and evaluating the benefits.
Taking necessary actions to allocate government housing and disburse furniture allowances to Ministry employees, in coordination with competent authorities.
Establishing and updating databases related to Ministry personnel affairs.

provisions.title: Article (9)
provisions.content:
The Financial and Administrative Affairs Department shall be responsible for the following:
Implementing financial and administrative laws, regulations, and systems related to the Ministry’s work.
Preparing the draft annual budget and final accounts of the Ministry, in coordination with the relevant administrative units.
Providing the Ministry and its administrative units with the necessary supplies and equipment to carry out their duties, in coordination with the concerned administrative units.
Carrying out procurement, tenders, and auctions, in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations of the State.
Supervising the implementation of financial allocations and auditing revenue and expenditure accounts.
Receiving, classifying, recording, and dispatching incoming and outgoing mail.
Organizing the Ministry’s archive and preserving documents using the latest methods.
Preparing the exchange documents and other financial transactions.
Collecting fees and service charges provided by the Ministry.
Performing all administrative service tasks.
Supervising the Ministry’s warehouses.

provisions.title: Article (10)
provisions.content:
The Information Systems Department shall be responsible for the following:
Preparing plans and policies for the use of computers in the Ministry’s activities and following up on their implementation.
Programming, storing, retrieving, and developing information systems and data necessary for the Ministry’s operations.
Securing systems, software, networks, and IT infrastructure against cybersecurity incidents.
Preparing disaster recovery plans to mitigate or prevent cybersecurity incidents, in line with information security policies and guidelines, and in coordination with the competent authority.
Providing and maintaining hardware, software, and electronic networks required for automated systems at the Ministry, in coordination with concerned administrative units.
Designing, operating, and managing databases and various types of information.
Providing technical support to users of the Ministry’s electronic networks and training them on how to use systems, programs, and related computer equipment.
Creating, monitoring, and updating the Ministry’s website on the internet.

provisions.title: Article (11)
provisions.content:
The Land Transport Planning Department shall be responsible for the following:
Setting the general policy for land transport planning in accordance with the State’s public policies.
Proposing and developing legislation related to land transport planning based on the State’s policies, in coordination with competent authorities.
Preparing and updating comprehensive and integrated strategic studies and plans for land transport, including all modes of land transport networks, in coordination with relevant entities.
Planning land transport networks in all their forms, including paved and unpaved roads, railways, pedestrian and bicycle paths and crossings, and approving their corridors in accordance with the outputs of the comprehensive transport plan.
Determining priorities and programs for land transport network projects using all transport modes, in line with the comprehensive transport plan, and in coordination with related entities.
Approving traffic impact studies related to development projects affecting road networks, in coordination with concerned entities.
Preparing and updating land transport models in accordance with approved land use and transport networks, in coordination with related entities.
Preparing and approving preliminary engineering designs for land transport networks and determining the entrances and exits of urban plots, in coordination with concerned entities.
Preparing and updating technical and engineering references and standards for planning and designing various types of land transport networks, in coordination with related entities.
Studying and giving technical opinions on draft international agreements related to land transport.

provisions.title: Article (12)
provisions.content:
The Land Transport Licensing Department shall be responsible for the following:
Establishing and developing conditions and regulations for issuing licenses, technical performance standards, and regulatory decisions for various land transport services, and ensuring compliance.
Establishing and developing the terms and conditions for issuing licenses, technical performance standards, rules and decisions regulating the licensing and operation of hazardous materials transportation activities, and ensuring compliance.
Setting standards and conditions for the quality performance of land transport services and ensuring compliance.
Proposing fees for various land transport service activities.
Receiving, studying, and issuing license applications for companies offering land transport services through various means.
Monitoring the performance of entities and companies licensed in the field of land transport.
Implementing the provisions of laws and regulations governing various land transport services, in coordination with relevant entities.
Proposing and developing legislative and regulatory frameworks related to land transport licensing activities and their facilities, based on the State’s public policies and in coordination with competent authorities.
Studying and giving opinions on draft international agreements related to the organization and licensing of land transport activities and the enhancement of service quality.

provisions.title: Article (13)
provisions.content:
The Road Affairs Department shall be responsible for the following:
Proposing and developing policies and strategies related to the operation and maintenance of road networks, in coordination with relevant authorities.
Preparing plans and programs for operating and maintaining road networks, and setting priorities, in coordination with the competent authorities.
Establishing standards and specifications for the operation, maintenance, and improvement of road networks, in coordination with the competent authorities, and ensuring compliance.
Ensuring the implementation of the road strategic plan and the quality of execution according to approved designs and programs, in coordination with relevant administrative units within the Ministry.
Receiving road assets from the Public Works Authority after completion by the contractor and the end of the designated maintenance period according to the contract, and following up on the maintenance of road projects.
Preserving road assets and their facilities and taking all necessary actions in this regard.
Preparing studies related to traffic movement and congestion, in coordination with relevant entities.
Establishing databases and information systems related to roads and traffic safety, in coordination with concerned authorities.
Preparing studies and analyzing data on traffic accidents, identifying their causes, and proposing appropriate solutions.
Proposing road safety measures, in coordination with relevant administrative units of the Ministry.
Preparing and updating references on specifications, standards, and technical guidelines required for the operation and maintenance of road networks and traffic safety, in coordination with concerned entities.
Studying and giving opinions on international and regional agreements related to roads and traffic safety.

provisions.title: Article (14)
provisions.content:
The Public Transport Affairs Department shall be responsible for the following:
Preparing necessary studies for the development of public transport in all its modes, and proposing and developing related plans, policies, strategies, and regulatory frameworks, in coordination with relevant administrative units of the Ministry.
Preparing studies to establish standards and regulations for issuing licenses and managing the performance of public transport services and operations.
Setting criteria and requirements for evaluating and selecting public transport operators, and ensuring compliance with performance and quality standards.
Developing a safe, environmentally friendly, and high-quality public transport system in all its modes, in line with environmental standards issued by competent authorities and in coordination with relevant administrative units of the Ministry.
Preparing and approving operational plans for public transport in all its modes, according to the outputs of the comprehensive transport plan and aligned with public transport strategies and priorities.
Developing and managing a unified fare and ticketing system for all modes of public transport.
Approving routes and schedules for organizing and operating public transport across all its modes.
Ensuring licensed entities comply with licensing standards and criteria for all modes of public transport.
Preparing and updating technical references and standards needed for planning public transport routes and networks, in coordination with relevant entities.
Studying and giving opinions on international and regional draft agreements related to public transport.

provisions.title: Article (15)
provisions.content:
The Maritime Transport Planning Department shall be responsible for the following:
Setting the general policy for maritime transport planning in light of the State’s public policies.
Developing rules and decisions regulating maritime transport activities and services.
Preparing necessary studies related to maritime transport routes and their development, in coordination with relevant authorities.
Conducting studies to develop and enhance the Qatari maritime fleet to boost its competitiveness.
Proposing draft laws, regulations, decisions, and rules governing maritime transport activities.
Proposing fees for maritime transport services and activities.
Ensuring that companies practicing maritime activities and the concerned administrative units comply with the general performance quality standards and conditions.
Implementing marine quality requirements issued by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO).
Preparing studies related to maritime transport projects and supervising and monitoring their implementation and maintenance, in coordination with concerned administrative units.
Preparing technical studies for cooperation memoranda in the field of maritime training.
Proposing training programs and maritime workshops.
Preparing safety and marine environment awareness booklets, in coordination with relevant entities.

provisions.title: Article (16)
provisions.content:
The Maritime Transport Licensing Department shall be responsible for the following:
Implementing laws, regulations, and decisions regulating maritime transport activities and services.
Preparing studies to determine the requirements for issuing and amending licenses for maritime transport activities and services.
Receiving, studying, and issuing license applications for practicing maritime transport activities and services.
Receiving, studying, and issuing license applications for ships to operate within Qatari waters.
Inspecting companies practicing maritime transport activities and ensuring they meet licensing requirements.
Establishing a classification register for companies engaged in maritime transport activities and services.
Studying complaints related to port operations and licensed companies and providing recommendations.
Conducting field visits to ensure companies comply with investigation recommendations.

provisions.title: Article (17)
provisions.content:
The Registration and Seafarers Affairs Department shall be responsible for the following:
Implementing the provisions of laws, regulations, and international maritime conventions related to registration and seafarers’ affairs.
Registering and deregistering ships, and issuing certificates in accordance with applicable international maritime conventions.
Collecting, classifying, analyzing, and updating the data in the ship certificate registers for ships registered under the Qatari flag.
Creating registers for registration, deregistration, mortgage, and seizure, and proposing amendments to them.
Registering, renewing, and deregistering marine vessels and wooden ships, issuing certificates, and inspecting them to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
Issuing and renewing licenses for operating marine vessels.
Receiving and reviewing license applications for establishing training institutes and centers for operating marine vessels, and issuing such licenses.
Issuing certificates of competency for seafarers.
Approving certificates of competency for crew members on Qatari ships.
Endorsing seafarer employment contracts.
Approving seafarers’ training and qualification certificates in accordance with the International Convention on Standards of Training, Certification, and Watchkeeping for Seafarers (STCW) and its amendments.
Ensuring that seafarer training and qualification centers comply with the STCW Convention and its amendments.
Issuing and renewing seafarers’ passports and documents in accordance with national laws and international maritime conventions.
Inspecting and surveying Qatari-flagged ships according to national laws and international maritime conventions.
Cancelling the navigation license of national ships that violate international maritime conventions.
Accrediting maritime classification societies and overseeing their performance.
Ensuring national ship-owning companies comply with national laws and international maritime conventions.

provisions.title: Article (18)
provisions.content:
The Marine Systems and Investigations Department shall be responsible for the following:
Proposing draft laws, decisions, regulations, and rules governing maritime transport in line with international maritime conventions.
Preparing technical studies for bilateral maritime transport agreements.
Preparing technical studies for accession to, amendment of, or withdrawal from international maritime conventions in force.
Preparing technical studies to determine the needs of maritime transport affairs in implementation of maritime instruments, and proposing amendments.
Proposing maritime circulars related to the safety of ships and navigation in Qatari waters.
Monitoring decisions and circulars issued by the International Maritime Organization (IMO) and forwarding them to relevant administrative units, authorities, and companies.
Investigating maritime incidents involving ships and marine vessels in Qatari waters and Qatari ships abroad, and submitting reports in accordance with the Code for the Investigation of Marine Casualties and Incidents.
Investigating violations by holders of certificates or state-endorsed certificates, in accordance with the Code for the Implementation of Instruments.
Investigating incidents involving cargo and ships at national ports and reporting on them.
Receiving reports on mandatory instruments and data from competent departments, authorities, and companies, and uploading them to the IMO website.

provisions.title: Article (19)
provisions.content:
The Maritime Safety Department shall be responsible for the following:
Implementing the provisions of laws, decisions, and international maritime conventions related to maritime safety.
Preparing studies related to the number and locations of navigational aids in Qatari waters and developing them.
Inspecting and surveying foreign ships in Qatari waters in accordance with local laws, international maritime conventions, and ratified memoranda of understanding.
Detaining foreign ships that pose a risk to maritime navigation or violate current international maritime conventions, in coordination with relevant authorities.
Approving port regulations and overseeing their implementation.
Approving security plans, emergency response plans, and handling and storage plans for hazardous materials at ports, in accordance with international maritime codes, and monitoring their implementation.
Overseeing port reception facilities in coordination with relevant authorities.
Approving the certification of port marine pilots.
Supervising and monitoring the compliance of national ports with the provisions of international maritime conventions.
Supervising and monitoring the marine navigation system and approving certifications of personnel involved in it.
Approving and implementing maritime routes and traffic separation schemes to regulate ship and vessel movements in Qatari waters.
Registering navigational aids in accordance with applicable laws and international maritime conventions.
Creating and maintaining records for registering and deregistering navigational aids, and proposing amendments.
Supervising and monitoring long-range identification and tracking systems (LRIT) and automatic identification systems (AIS) for ships.
Issuing navigational notices.

provisions.title: Article (20)
provisions.content: The responsibilities of the Minister’s Office, the Undersecretary’s Office, and the Assistant Undersecretary’s Office shall be determined by a decision issued by the Minister.

provisions.title: Article (21)
provisions.content: By a decision of the Council of Ministers, and based on the Minister’s proposal, the organizational structure of the Ministry’s administrative units may be amended through addition, deletion, or merger, and their responsibilities may be assigned or modified.

provisions.title: Article (22)
provisions.content: The Minister may, by decision, establish departments within the Ministry’s administrative units as required by the public interest, or cancel or merge them, and assign or amend their responsibilities. Such decision by the Minister shall not be effective until approved by the Council of Ministers.

provisions.title: Article (23)
provisions.content: Amiri Decision No. (8) of 2016 referred to herein is hereby repealed.

provisions.title: Article (24)
provisions.content:
All the competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this Decision. It shall come into force from the date of its issuance, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.
Tamim Bin Hamad Al Thani
Amir of the State of Qatar
Issued at the Amiri Diwan on: 28/03/1444 (H)
Corresponding to: 24/10/2022 (AD)
